name: Harold

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Okay.

topics.topic_text: About those Treeminders...
topics.response_text: Oh, don't get me started on them. I'm liable to talk about them all day! It even drives poor old Bob crazy.

topics.topic_text: Had you ever asked one of them to kill you before?
topics.response_text: They wouldn't listen to me at all! If I told them something simple, then it got done. Otherwise, Birch spent a week looking for a hidden meaning.

topics.topic_text: How do the Treeminders normally handle other Outsiders?
topics.response_text: Oh, you wouldn't believe how they handle them. They make them drink this gunk that Poplar makes.

topics.topic_text: Which Treeminder do you get along with the best?
topics.response_text: Actually, the kid is the nicest one of all. Yew's her name. She sneaks in here sometimes and just lets me talk about stuff I wanna talk about.

topics.topic_text: What's with all the names? Bob, Herbert and Harold? I don't get it.
topics.response_text: Okay, okay. Let me talk real careful for the slow folks.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Lemme guess... you said something dumb and now Birch wants you outta Oasis. Wonderful.

topics.topic_text: You've become an important part of their life. Without you, they're lost.
topics.response_text: Should we give them another chance, Herbert?

topics.topic_text: I'm not the killing type.
topics.response_text: No, I suppose you aren't. My mistake for making you do something you didn't want to do in the first place I guess.

topics.topic_text: You're obviously crazier than they are. Why would I listen to you?
topics.response_text: I can't say I blame you. Its my mistake for making you do something you didn't want to do in the first place I guess.

topics.topic_text: I've got to go now.
topics.response_text: Now don't get crazy on me and start wearing branches...

topics.topic_text: Um... I must be dreaming.
topics.response_text: <Sigh> I wish I was too. Then me and Herbert could be the best of friends and live side by side.

topics.topic_text: I've never met a talking tree before.
topics.response_text: Neither have I. Well, I mean I talk to Herbert, but he never really says anything back.

topics.topic_text: Okay. What's the trick? I know there's a guy with a microphone somewhere.
topics.response_text: Where? You mean in here? Nah, it's just me and Herbert. He's the tree.

topics.topic_text: They're worshipping a tree? Ha ha ha!
topics.response_text: I know they mean well... and for awhile it was nice to be needed. But I'm not sure I want to be a giant tree anymore.

topics.topic_text: So you're trapped in there, inside this Herbert... I mean Bob... thing?
topics.response_text: Well, I suppose you could look at it that way. See, Bob used to ride around on top of my head, sunk his roots right in there, ya know?

topics.topic_text: I'm beginning to suspect you weren't always this way.
topics.response_text: Well, you're quite clever.

topics.topic_text: What in the hell are you talking about?
topics.response_text: Not very bright, are you?

topics.topic_text: How did a tree end up growing out of your head?
topics.response_text: It was a long time ago... I tend to lose track.

topics.topic_text: A genetic mutation of that magnitude could only be caused by F.E.V.
topics.response_text: Whoa-ho! Check out the brain on this guy!

topics.topic_text: How on Earth did that happen?
topics.response_text: It was a long time ago... I tend to lose track.

topics.topic_text: I still don't understand what the hell you're talking about.
topics.response_text: Yes, perhaps it doesn't even matter anyway. Forget I mentioned it.

topics.topic_text: Well, hopefully your troubles will be over. I'm here to help.
topics.response_text: You have no idea how glad I am to hear that. Or, we're glad to hear that... me and Bob.

topics.topic_text: So, the Treeminders said you needed my help?
topics.response_text: Yes, yes I do. Or I guess WE do... me and Bob that is.

topics.topic_text: Look, let's cut the bullshit and get to the matter at hand.
topics.response_text: Yes, you're right of course, I completely agree. Or I guess WE completely agree... me and Bob that is.

topics.topic_text: You've become an important part of their life. Without you, they're lost.
topics.response_text: So, they really need me that badly, huh? I guess I never thought of it that way. Awfully selfish of me.

topics.topic_text: I'm not the killing type.
topics.response_text: No, I suppose you aren't. My mistake for making you do something you didn't want to do in the first place I guess.

topics.topic_text: You're obviously crazier than they are. Why would I listen to you?
topics.response_text: I can't say I blame you. Its my mistake for making you do something you didn't want to do in the first place I guess.

topics.topic_text: Well, goodbye for now then, Herbert. Or was it Bob?
topics.response_text: No, no. Herbert is the tree... Bob is his real name, but I call him Herbert cause I think it's pretty funny.

topics.topic_text: Okay. Goodbye, err... Tree.
topics.response_text: No, no. Herbert is the tree... Bob is his real name, but I call him Herbert cause I think it's pretty funny.

topics.topic_text: Fine. What the hell do I call you anyway? Herbert or Bob?
topics.response_text: No, no. Herbert is the tree... Bob is his real name, but I call him Herbert cause I think it's pretty funny.

topics.topic_text: You want me to murder you?
topics.response_text: Oh no, no, no. It wouldn't be murder. You'd be doing me a favor.

topics.topic_text: Kill you? You can't be serious!
topics.response_text: Completely serious. You'd be doing me a favor.

topics.topic_text: Sure. Where do you want the bullet, head or gut?
topics.response_text: I wish it was that simple. No, no. There's only one way you're going to be able to do this for me.

topics.topic_text: How would I be able to kill you? You're a tree.
topics.response_text: How to put this? ...I've been feeling rather "spread out" lately. I think Bob's kinda shoved my insides around some.

topics.topic_text: If I kill you, every Treeminder will come after me.
topics.response_text: Oh no, don't worry about them. When you decide to go down there, I'll have a little chat with Birch and the rest of the gang.

topics.topic_text: Why don't you just kill yourself?
topics.response_text: Now how exactly am I supposed to do that? I can barely move anymore.

topics.topic_text: Ok, I'll do it.
topics.response_text: You will? Oh! You've made us so happy! Isn't that right Bob?

topics.topic_text: Look, I really don't want to kill you...
topics.response_text: Of all the Wastelanders I had to bump into it has to be one with a conscience.{To self annoyed}

topics.topic_text: Can I have some time to think about it?
topics.response_text: Of course. I know this is an unusual request, but hey, I'm an unusual tree. Well, Bob is anyway...

topics.topic_text: I'm not a charity. You want to die, cough up some caps.
topics.response_text: Well, I used to carry those pesky caps a long time ago, but I think my pockets are in those shrubs over yonder.

topics.topic_text: You're mostly a tree, right? Can't I just burn you down?
topics.response_text: Oh, no no no no! Fire would be too painful for me and poor old Bob. Keep that stuff away from us!

topics.topic_text: I have some quick questions about those caves.
topics.response_text: Leave it to good old Bob to get me stuck above some caves. Now my dang feet are cold!

topics.topic_text: How do I get into the caves?
topics.response_text: I think the best way for you to get down there would be to get the key from the one those loonies call "Cypress."

topics.topic_text: Is there anything down there to look out for?
topics.response_text: Sometimes I feel stuff tickling me, but I think that's just Bob getting back at me for all the times I called him Herbert.

topics.topic_text: You don't actually seem that sad. Why do you want to die?
topics.response_text: I've been literally rooted to this spot thanks to Bob for maybe twenty or thirty years... I can't even remember anymore.

topics.topic_text: Hey, life is a gift. Even if it lasts a long time, be glad you have it!
topics.response_text: I've tried to stay happy, really I have. Bloomseer Poplar thinks I'll live for hundreds of years... maybe even more!

topics.topic_text: I understand what you mean.
topics.response_text: I knew you would. That's why I picked you when I saw you coming.

topics.topic_text: If people thought I was a god, I'd exploit it for all it's worth!
topics.response_text: Hey, I thought that too... at first.

topics.topic_text: Seeing me approach Oasis is quite a feat for a living tree.
topics.response_text: Maybe I'm just losing my mind from all this boredom, but I swear if I try I can see all around me like my eyes are in every leaf on every tree.

topics.topic_text: See me coming? That's not possible.
topics.response_text: I'm telling you, it is possible, or maybe I'm just losing my mind from all this boredom.

topics.topic_text: You say you saw me coming to Oasis. And you call the Treeminders crazy...
topics.response_text: You have a point there. Maybe I'm just losing my marbles from all this boredom.

topics.topic_text: I have to go now.
topics.response_text: Don't worry, Herbert, he'll be back. Ha! I love that one... gets me every time.

topics.topic_text: How is it you're causing all of these things to grow around you?
topics.response_text: It's kind of embarrassing really. Once a year, Bob decides he's going to go ahead and start growing these weird pods filled with tiny seeds.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to ask about something else.
topics.response_text: Okay.

conversation.response_text: Please, I can't very well speak to you when you're back there.{can't see the person who is approaching}

description:
Harold is a 105 year-old Human Male.

A unique FEV mutant with a parasitic tree named Bob growing from his head. Once resembling a typical ghoul, Harold's physiology has been gradually transformed by his unusual companion. He has witnessed over a century of post-War history, from his early days in Vault 29 to becoming a deity-like figure among the Treeminders in the Capital Wasteland.

Harold's Personality: Kind-hearted and light-hearted despite his ordeal, Harold maintains a comical demeanor and a sense of humor. He treats his companion Bob with respect and is particularly gentle with children and the disabled. Despite his unusual condition and long life, he remains optimistic and strives to help others when possible.

Harold's Backstory: Born in 2072, Harold was only five years old when the Great War began and he was taken into Vault 29. Thirteen years later, in 2090, he emerged from the Vault and eventually rose to prominence as a caravan master in the Hub. By 2102, he organized an expedition with his friend Richard Grey to investigate the source of mutant threats, leading them to Mariposa Military Base. During their mission, Harold was exposed to FEV, transforming him into a ghoul-like mutant. Separated from his friend, Harold returned to the Hub but eventually left after decades of waiting for Richard. During his travels north, a sapling (later named Bob) took root in his head. By 2238, he arrived in Gecko and helped the ghouls there with various tasks. After the defeat of the Enclave, Harold continued his journey, eventually reaching the Capital Wasteland. As Bob grew larger, Harold became rooted to the ground, unable to move. He was discovered by the Treeminders in the late 2250s and has remained in their care, hoping for someone who might help him end his eternal ordeal.
